context: This evaluation criteria assesses how well the engineer uses the @emoji-toolkit/colorizer package to implement an emoji text normalizer. The focus is exclusively on the correct and proficient use of the package's skin tone modification API.

checklist.name: Use applyAllSkinTones
checklist.description: The normalizeSkinTones function uses the applyAllSkinTones function from @emoji-toolkit/colorizer to apply consistent skin tones to all compatible emojis in text.

checklist.name: Use getSkinTone
checklist.description: The hasSkinToneModifiers function uses getSkinTone from @emoji-toolkit/colorizer to detect whether emojis have skin tone modifiers. The implementation should check multiple emojis in the text and return true if any emoji has a skin tone.

checklist.name: Use removeSkinTone
checklist.description: The stripSkinTones function uses removeSkinTone from @emoji-toolkit/colorizer to remove skin tone modifiers from emojis. The implementation should process all emojis in the text to strip their skin tones.

checklist.name: Correct SkinTone type
checklist.description: The code imports and uses the SkinTone type from @emoji-toolkit/colorizer or defines it correctly as the union type 'light' | 'medium-light' | 'medium' | 'medium-dark' | 'dark' matching the package's definition.
